options: Its source code is available to the public
It was created by a non-profit
round1.answer: Its source code is available to the public

round1.question: What is the primary purpose of an HTML `<div>` tag?
options: To act as a container for other elements
round1.answer: To act as a container for other elements

round3.question: In database transactions, what does the 'A' in the 'ACID' acronym stand for?
What is the core principle of 'idempotency' in API design, especially for RESTful services?
options: Making the same request once has the same effect as making it multiple times
The API must respond in less than 100ms
Data should be returned in JSON format only
round3.answer: Making the same request once has the same effect as making it multiple times

round3.question: What famous algorithm, developed by Edsger Dijkstra, is used to find the shortest path between nodes in a graph?
What is the concept of bundling data and the methods that operate on that data into a single 'class' called?
What is the fundamental difference between a 'compiler' and an 'interpreter'?
options: A compiler translates the entire program at once; an interpreter translates it line by line
A compiler is for web, an interpreter is for apps
round3.answer: A compiler translates the entire program at once; an interpreter translates it line by line

round3.question: What does DNS stand for in computer networking, and what is its primary role?
options: Domain Name System; it resolves domain names to IP addresses
Data Naming Service; it names data packets
Dynamic Network Service; it assigns IP addresses
Domain Naming Standard; it standardizes domain names
round3.answer: Domain Name System; it resolves domain names to IP addresses

round3.question: In software design, what is the 'Singleton Pattern' used for?
options: To ensure a class has only one instance and provide a global point of access to it
To create objects without specifying the exact class of object that will be created
To allow an object to alter its behavior when its internal state changes
To attach additional responsibilities to an object dynamically
round3.answer: To ensure a class has only one instance and provide a global point of access to it

round3.question: What is the primary purpose of 'Big O Notation' in computer science?
options: To describe the precise speed of an algorithm
To describe how the runtime or space requirements of an algorithm grow as the input size grows
To calculate the number of operations in a program
To notate the order of functions in a class
round3.answer: To describe how the runtime or space requirements of an algorithm grow as the input size grows

round3.question: In the context of REST APIs, which HTTP method is best suited for creating a new resource?
What is the 'Agile' methodology in software development?
options: A way to write code faster
An iterative approach to project management and software development
round3.answer: An iterative approach to project management and software development

round3.question: What is the 'Factory' design pattern primarily used for?
options: Creating objects without specifying the exact class of object that will be created
Ensuring only one instance of a class exists
Adding new functionality to an existing object
round3.answer: Creating objects without specifying the exact class of object that will be created

round3.question: In the 7-layer OSI model of computer networking, what is Layer 1 called?
